description.narrative: (Tanzania): .FY 2019 funding will continue to support the increased utilization of sustainable, multiple-use water and sanitation services. WARIDI will construct and commission 34 water supply schemes that will serve approximately 305,970 people. These water supply schemes will be solar pumped schemes in rural and urban settings. WARIDI will also continue implementation of 14 open defecation free and school water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) grants. These grants accelerate and sustain the sanitation and hygiene behavior change among targeted communities across 14 districts and in selected schools. Beyond the end of the grants, in the first quarter of FY 2020, WARIDI will continue to focus on the sustainability of the interventions, as well as packaging and sharing the activity's lessons learned. The activity will build the management and governance capacity of the National Water Board and continue capacity strengthening support for the two Basin Water Boards. WARIDI will use FY 2019 funds to provide continued support to Tanzania's private sector to become more self-reliant by engaging private companies to advance and support WASH interventions, making them more scalable, innovative and sustainable. WARIDI will also identify opportunities to scale up impact by connecting partners to financing mechanisms, and supporting partners to refine their business models... .... .
